title: Sulfur-doped silicon oxycarbide by facile pyrolysis process as an outstanding stable performance lithium-ion battery anode
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,29999-30010
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA04608K, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Jungjin Park, Won Young An, Keunho Lee, Seungman Park, Minjun Bae, Seon Jae Hwang, Hwichan Hong, Yonghwan Kim, Taehyun Yoo, Dohyeong Kim, Jong Min Kim, Yuanzhe Piao
Silicon oxycarbide (SiOC) is drawing significant attention as a potential anode material for lithium-ion batteries due to its remarkable cycle life and the distinctive Si–O–C hybrid bonding within its structure.
